title: 110_s3713
content: The Act is titled the "Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center Act of 2008" and involves the transfer of property. Upon the conclusion of a resource-sharing agreement, the Secretary of Defense may transfer the Navy ambulatory care center, parking structure, and supporting facilities in Great Lakes, Illinois to the Department of Veterans Affairs for joint use. The Navy ambulatory care center in Great Lakes, Illinois may be transferred to the Department of Veterans Affairs for joint use as the "Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center." If the property is used for other purposes, it may revert back to the Secretary of Defense. The Navy ambulatory care center in Great Lakes, Illinois may be transferred to the Department of Veterans Affairs for joint use as the "Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center." If the integration of the facilities is not successful within 5 years, the property will revert back to the Secretary of Defense. The Navy ambulatory care center in Great Lakes, Illinois may be transferred to the Department of Veterans Affairs for joint use as the "Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center." If the integration is not successful within 5 years, the property will revert back to the Secretary of Defense. After the initial 5-year period, if either Secretary determines that integration should not continue, the property will be transferred without reimbursement. SEC. 3. TRANSFER OF CIVILIAN PERSONNEL OF THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE. The Secretary of Defense may transfer functions to the Department of Veterans Affairs for the Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center. This transfer is governed by a resource-sharing agreement between the two departments. The agreement allows for the transfer of civilian employee positions from the Department of Defense to the Department of Veterans Affairs, ensuring no reduction in pay, grade, or employment progression for the employees. The agreement includes provisions for employee transfers, integrated seniority lists, and other personnel management matters deemed appropriate by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Defense has the authority to establish civilian employee positions and utilize personnel authorities as needed to meet Department of Defense mission requirements. SEC. 4. Extension and expansion of Joint Incentive Fund to 2020. Funding for maintenance and minor construction projects from the fund is expanded. SEC. 5. Health care eligibility at the Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center. The Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center may be deemed a facility of the uniformed services for health care eligibility under chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code. An agreement between the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs may establish an integrated priority list for access to care at the facility. The Captain James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center may be designated as a facility for health care eligibility under chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code. The agreement between the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs may establish an integrated priority list for access to care at the facility, including resource-related limitations and financial responsibility allocation. Additionally, provisions of section 8111(e) of title 38, United States Code, may be waived for the facility as specified by the Secretaries.
